com.centurylink.mdw.timer.cleanup

Class ProcessCleanup

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.centurylink.mdw.model.monitor.LoadBalancedScheduledJob
      • com.centurylink.mdw.services.workflow.RoundRobinScheduledJob
        • com.centurylink.mdw.timer.cleanup.ProcessCleanup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RegisteredService, ScheduledJob

    public class ProcessCleanup
extends RoundRobinScheduledJob
    This script cleans up old database entries from tables that are older than a specified time Make sure appropriate db package is imported and Cleanup-Runtime.sql is there. Add following to mdw.yaml timer.task: ProcessCleanup: # run every 15 min TimerClass: com.centurylink.mdw.timer.cleanup.ProcessCleanup Schedule: 0,15,30,45 * * * * # to run daily at 2:30 am use : Schedule: 30 2 * * ? * RuntimeCleanupScript: Cleanup-Runtime.sql ProcessExpirationAgeInDays: 225 #How old process instance should be to be a candidate for deleting MaximumProcessExpiration: 1 #How many process instances to be deleted in each run ExternalEventExpirationAgeInDays: 225 CommitInterval: 1000 if you need to make change in above properties then first delete the db entry by identifying the row using this sql: select * from event_instance where event_name like '%ScheduledJob%' Then re-start the server/instance for new clean-up properties to be effective.
